Same Capacity: Precisely the same and  identical  issues or questions must have  been  decided

(iv): There is the further requirement that the particular issue should have been determined by a court
of competent jurisdiction  [Mills v.  Cooper (1967)  2 Q.B.  459 at 468].
The  proceedings  before  the  Labour Tribunal  and  the  High  Court  satisfy  the  criteria  in  (i)  to  (iv)

Same Capacity: above and the requirement in Mills v.  Cooper (supra). The only issue which merits a consideration

(iv): by this Court is  whether precisely the same  and  identica l iss ues were decided .
